attributes.action: Introduce pre-referendum as an entry requirement before future major referendums
attributes.background: Before important future referendum i.e. like should UK be in the EU or not? A pre-referendum is issued first  to ensure that eligible voters understand what they are voting for. The results of pre-referendum should be used as weighting to set the criteria that main referendum is considered passed.
attributes.additional_details: It is obvious from personal stories from friends and families and other stories trending on the internet that a significant number of people voted when they did not know what they were really voting for and also were using as a protest rather than considering and forming balanced opinion based on informed arguments for yes or no.

attributes.action: Parliamentary inquiry into deceitful claims to sway an election or referendum
attributes.background: The Brexit campaign dishonestly pledged Â£350 million per week for the NHS in full knowledge that this was was an impossibility.  This is just one example of a growing trend in British politics.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a growing tendency for candidates to field statements that they know to be wrong merely to gain a vote for their party or themselves.  Integrity is being eroded together with the high standards that once reflected British politics and decisions.  Can a successful vote won on the basis of deceit be democratically or morally valid?
I believe that it is time to openly discuss this problem through the proper vehicle of a parliamentary enquiry into such practices.

attributes.action: Hold a second EU membership referendum within 18 months.
attributes.background:
(1) Young people could not vote.
(2) Voters based their decision to leave on incomplete information.
(3) Winning margin was too narrow. 

A referendum of this weight should allow 16 - 17 year old people to vote. 

The UK should only exit if leave vote wins by a substantial margin.
attributes.additional_details:
(1) http://goo.gl/krTYyR (Independent)

(2) http://goo.gl/wBfX74 (The Guardian) and https://goo.gl/1Jd1Mp (Washington Post)

(3) http://goo.gl/SXEWTS (Mirror)

To quote the UKIP leadership, the winning margin was too narrow and therefore this is unfinished business by a long way.

The very existence of the United Kingdom as we know it and of the European Union, built over 7 decades, hangs in the balance.

attributes.action: Hold a second Brexit referendum in 2 years so that more young voters have a say.
attributes.background: Article 50 means that we do not formally leave the EU for at least two years. During this time a large number of 16-17 year olds will become eligible to vote. The government will not lower the voting age, but we should allow eligible youngsters to decide either way on their future.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should also consider working with the youth parliament and implementing a way of allowing them to have a say on their future.

attributes.action: Second EU referendum after a suggested "cool down" period of 2 months.
attributes.background: 23rd of June saw the United Kingdom EU referendum. Campaigning on both sides was not comprehensive enough for informed decisions to be made creating a failed democratic result with consequences only being realised after the1st referendum. A second, more informed, truthful referendum is required
attributes.additional_details: There have now been a number of revelations made by prominent Leave campaigners after the referendum has completed that what they said during the build up to the referendum was untrue. Democracy only functions when the populous has factually correct information in which to base their decisions - in the first referendum, this unfortunately was not the case. If a 2nd referendum is held and results are within 5% of each other, the decision should be given to the UK government to vote upon.

attributes.action: Honour the Brexit result by repealing s2, European Communities Act 1972, NOW.
attributes.background: In view of another petition demanding that the Brexit result be ignored and another referendum held, we clearly need an alternative one that can be supported by all those who believe in democracy.

attributes.action: Provide a way to account for children's opinion on issues affecting their future
attributes.background: 14 million under 18s live in the UK and aren't able to vote. According to Unicef they have the right for their views to be heard and respected. When important debates are taking place, directly affecting their future, we propose that their opinions should be officially collated by Government.
attributes.additional_details:
.UN Convention on the Rights of the Child, Article 12 (respect for the views of the child) and Article 13 (freedom of expression).
.Improving the Spiritual, Moral, Social and Cultural (SMSC) development of pupils: Departmental advice for independent schools, academies and free schools (DfE November 2013, p5)
.Section 78 of the Education Act 2002
.UNICEF- Promoting Children's Participation in Democratic Decision Making (Gerison Lansdown, UNICEF Innocenti Research Centre, ISBN: 88-85401-73-2)

attributes.action: Trans issues should be taught as part of Personal, Social and Health Education
attributes.background: Trans issues should be taught as part of Personal, Social and Health Education. Also, Gender-variant young people should get sufficient support at school. Schools need to understand their responsibilities under the Equality Act 2010 and must ensure all staff receive training.
attributes.additional_details: The House of Commons Women and Equalities Committee published a report in January 2016 with regards to Transgender Equality. Within this report it was established that more needs to be done to ensure that gender-variant young people receive support in school. the Equality and Human Rights Commission stated that research shows that 91% of trans boys and 66% of trans girls experience harassment or bullying at school, leading to depression, isolation and the desire to leave education.

attributes.action: No more cuts for working age people. Remove ringfencing of pensioner benefits
attributes.background: Since the financial crisis and recession it's young and working age people who have born the brunt of budget cutbacks. Real wages have fallen 7% for working families and 16% for 18-24 year olds. Pensioners have seen a 4% increase in the incomes which is neither fair or sustainable going forward.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst efforts to raise living standards in the elderly population is commendable, the disparity is now too great and ringfencing of pensioner benefits should be removed. This has become even more pressing in light out the EU referendum where the over 65 group voted strongly in favour of leaving the EU. Any negative economic effects of this decision should be shared across all who voted for it.

Figures quoted from Machin 2015

attributes.action: The government should rerun the referendum on our membership of the EU.
attributes.background: The binary question of leave or remain should have a third choice: Remain as a member with reforms met within a specified deadline. If the deadline is not met then we leave.

attributes.action: Say No to a Norway style deal with the EU!
attributes.background:
A Government based think tank is considering negotiating a Norway Style deal with the EU!

This should not even be considered as it is a watered down version of our past liability with the EU and that is what we overwhelmingly voted to be rid of!
attributes.additional_details:
Norway STILL has free movement of immigrants from the EU. 

Our Commonwealth friends, the rest of the world and indeed Germany has already confirmed that they still want to trade with us, so we make our own deals with what suits us. For 43 years we have been trading with a strait jacket on, imposed on us by Europe in compliance with their many rules and regs that we have now voted to reject.


Please listen to the people that have asked for change and voted us out of the EU, do the right thing and look after the British people first and foremost for a change and help us to achieve our full potential, which is one of power and greatness.

If you agree, please sign the petition.

attributes.action: Call another EU referendum for those aged 16-30
attributes.background: What should have been done previously and what should be addressed now, is the importance of the generation whom the EU referendum would effect. Therefore it is my request that as a generation, we should be given the choice, rather than our elders making that choice for us.

attributes.action: Count non-voters as a vote for the status quo in referendums.
attributes.background: People who vote do so to express their choice.  By not voting, people are saying they are not really concerned either way.  If they held a strong conviction they would have voted.  Change should not be imposed without taking these non-voters into account.
attributes.additional_details:
The in-out EU referendum is a case in point. Fewer than half the voting public voted for change but change will happen because insufficient people voted for the status quo.

Non-voters who weren't really concerned, or who didn't vote because they thought the status quo would win, should have their 'vote' counted.

To make a significant change (eg leaving the EU) more than half of the voting public should vote for it, ie not half of the voters.

attributes.action: Allow 15,16 and 17 year olds to vote in a second referendum.
attributes.background: The generation of people who were not allowed to vote will be the ones who are most affected by the change. Therefore they should be allowed a say in their future by having a vote in a second referendum.
attributes.additional_details: 75% of 18-24 year olds voted remain, this shows that the young people of our population want to stay and should be given a chance to make this happen.

attributes.action: Get better broadband speeds in SE16.
attributes.background: I live in London (SE16) and have very low broadband speeds that aren't acceptable. At the moment I can get up to 2.6mbps (download) and 0.4mbps (upload). Living in the middle of London, you would expect to get fibre optic lines or have at least 10mbps.
attributes.additional_details: We keep being told that we will get better speeds soon. "Soon" seems to never happen as I've been hoping for better speeds since 2012.

attributes.action: Begin a UK Space Program
attributes.background:
The UK is leaving the EU, which means the ESA (European Space Agency) will no longer be the go-to for UK citizens interested in space.
Form a UK Space Program so that the UK may participate in the advancement of space related science and exploration.

attributes.action: Hold a second, and if necessary, third EU Referendum for a best-of-three vote.
attributes.background:
With the EU Referendum results having been announced, there is a clear divide between the country, a result bordering a tie with less than a two-percent margin. 
Those undersigned believe that a second vote should be held, to confirm the wishes of the British people, with a third vote if necessary.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a big decision for our country. The results of the first EU referendum to decide whether or not we should remain within the European Union have already affected our nation in significant ways, most notable of which being the value of the pound, and that decision should not be left for a singular vote.

If a second vote were to happen, and the results declared the same, then no more referendums would be necessary and such a decision taken forward.

attributes.action: People over the age of 70 should not be allowed to vote
attributes.background: With the latest Brexit it is clear to see this was due to the votes of the older generation and not the younger one. However it is young people's future and they can't vote. If there is a limit on young age, why not old age?

attributes.action: Those who couldn't vote in the EU referendum (flooding and travel) to vote!
attributes.background: Many people were affected by the floods and polling stations so were unable to vote. Reopen voting to allow these people to vote.

attributes.action: Referendum for all Inner London boroughs to leave the United Kingdom
attributes.background: All Inner London Boroughs voted unanimously to remain within the European Union with over 60% voting remain. The decision by the rest of the UK to leave the EU means there should be a referendum for Inner London boroughs to leave the UK and become an independent country within the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
London provides 22% of UK GDP.
If the capital was an independent country, its Â£534,821 million GDP would make it the 18th largest economy in the world, just below the Netherlands. 
Outer London boroughs such as Sutton and Barking & Dagenham voted Leave therefore the independence referendum should be for Inner London boroughs.

attributes.action: All licenced bars and clubs should have a breathalyser to prevent drink driving
attributes.background: This petition is to ask the government to make all licenced bars and clubs which serve alcohol to have breathalysers at hand for patrons to use if in control of a vehicle. This would minimise the risks associated with driving over the drink drive limit and would inturn reduce drink drive fatalities.

attributes.action: Means test Maternity Pay reflecting women on leave who are 'the breadwinner'
attributes.background:
The current basic ruling on maternity pay is as follows :

Statutory Maternity Pay (SMP) is paid for up to 39 weeks. You get:
- 90% of your average weekly earnings (before tax) for the first 6 weeks
- Â£139.58 or 90% of your average weekly earnings (whichever is lower) for the next 33 weeks
attributes.additional_details:
Information from:
https://www.gov.uk/maternity-pay-leave/pay

attributes.action: Enforce all secondary schools to teach Drama, Art and Music at key stage three.
attributes.background:
The majority of jobs require creativity, and although you need natural talent, if these subjects are not taught, the youth will never have the freedom to think creatively and explore a world other than academia. 
Without creativity where will the next Branson, Ant & Dec, or Kelly Hoppen come from?

attributes.action: Ensure that in future, qualifying persons are automatically registered to vote.
attributes.background:
To vote in a UK election a person must be "registered to vote" and also: 18 or over, be a British citizen, a qualifying Commonwealth citizen or a citizen of the Republic of Ireland.

The requirement to register should be dropped so that those meeting criteria are automatically able to vote.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/electoral-register

attributes.action: Care homes to be required by law to provide Mario Kart gaming for residents.
attributes.background: This petition was started by a medical student who recently attended an Elderly Medicine placement in Derbyshire. In many Local Authority owned care homes, residents would be sat passively in front of the lounge television screen. Residents may enjoy a competitive, interactive activity instead.
attributes.additional_details: "When groups of generally healthy medical patients aged 50 and over were instructed to play a video game that increased in difficulty and complexity with each new level, researchers at the University of Iowa found that they gained years of cognitive processing improvement after one year of play." Lynn, Kecia (2015). More Proof That Elderly People Should Play More Video Games. Big Think. http://bigthink.com/ideafeed/more-proof-that-elderly-people-should-play-more-video-games

attributes.action: Ban leashing dogs by their collar, in favour of front-chest harnesses
attributes.background:
Being leashed by the neck puts pressure and damage on:

- the trachea (windpipe)
- the spinal cord 
- the vertebral discs, 
- the oesophagus (gullet)

Harnesses offer better safety and comfort, alleviating pressure on the neck and also allowing the owner to better pull the dog from harms way.
attributes.additional_details: "I have observed the relationships between the neck injuries and health of dogs, and learned that if the flow of energy in the neck is interrupted or restricted, a whole array of problems may arise, including lameness, skin issues, allergies, lung and heart problems, digestive issues, ear and eye conditions and thyroid gland dysfunctions. I also suspect that the patients who have severe energy flow congestion in the neck area have higher cancer rates" - Dr. Peter Dobias, Holistic Veterinarian.

attributes.action: Introduce basic income in the UK for every citizen whether they work or not.
attributes.background: I believe that if everyone receives a basic income, whether they are working or not, it will make citizens feel more equal.
attributes.additional_details: We really do need this proposal to go ahead because there are so many people that are homeless or not at work, and are struggling to live of minimal benefits. So if this basic income is introduced, I feel that less people will be homeless and can live their lives normally.

attributes.action: Put a cap on how many clients carers/nurses can supply care to in healthcare.
attributes.background: In nurseries there is a ratio of 1 nursery nurse per 3 children depending on age. I want the same for the elderly. 1 carer for 4 clients needing care. 1 nurse for 5 clients. This obviously is just an estimate, it depends on other factors and should be looked into.

attributes.action: Receiving Carers Allowance should not affect other benefits or taxes
attributes.background: People who receive Carers Allowance should not have to pay extra tax or have their other benefits cut. People receiving a state pension must also be able to claim Carers Allowance while looking after a loved one. Mandy Bayliffe tried to change things in her short life so now we must.
attributes.additional_details: Carers Allowance should be tax-free, like PIP, and shouldnât affect any other benefits that carers may receive. I am 67 years old, in receipt of a State Pension, which I paid for through 40 years of work. Yet I cannot claim Carers Allowance because the Government does not allow you to claim both. This means men and women who can claim their State Pensions are excluded. These same people are more often than not by their loved ones sides 24/7 yet receive no recompense for it either.

attributes.action: Impose legislation to allow online cancellation of services bought online
attributes.background: Many services such as insurance, credit record services and music streaming can be bought online, 24 hours a day. However in most cases customers are required to telephone between certain hours on certain days & speak to a salesperson who will try to convince the customer to stay.
attributes.additional_details:
This practice is limiting choice & costing the public money when they are forced to continue paying for a service they no longer require because companies make the process deliberately difficult to protect their profit.

We request the government impose a legal requirement on all services that provide on-line signup to also provide an easy on-line cancellation process with the same availability without unreasonable limitations.

attributes.action: Ensure that children's safeguarding be monitored by specific named professionals
attributes.background: The Woods LSCB review states that challenge by the LSCB is vital, but the government response to the review gives responsibility to public bodies with no named professional to offer challenge or monitor change. Revised LSCB terms of reference could provide this and safeguard vulnerable children.
attributes.additional_details: The best performing LSCBs are those with strong chairs that provide robust challenge and monitor improvement. The government response to this review is to remove the statutory strength that permits this challenge. This government has a duty to ensure that its duties are wholly taken over by a named role/team within or independent of these agencies and safeguard vulnerable children, a team already existent in current LSCBs that could be strengthened by revised terms of reference.

attributes.action: Stop children from being punished for their hair at school.
attributes.background: I believe that all children in the UK should be allowed to have a hairstyle that they like, rather than being force to have hair that is considered 'decent' by the school. Children should not be punished for having a hair style that expresses their personality, but schools still have the right to.
attributes.additional_details: My son got placed in isolation for going into school with short hair a few months ago. I can understand their stance on no makeup or nail polish (not that this would apply to my child) due to it able to be changed before and after school. However, someone cannot change the length or colour of their hair. Whilst my child broke the school rules without good reason, a friend of his has a mum that was diagnosed with cancer. So, his friend shaved his head to support her but got punished.

attributes.action: Ban being able to own, and have a cockerel in an urban area, they are loud.
attributes.background: I have an inconsiderate neighbour, who will not put a collar on their cockerel to reduce the noise of the crow, the cockerel cannot help it, that's the way God made it, but us humans need to keep the animals in the country and out of urban area.

attributes.action: Make throwing bread and crumbs to birds a non littering offence.
attributes.background: I threw a bit of bread on the floor for the birds to eat, and I got an on the spot fine for doing this, even after I went picked it up and put it in the bin. The council workers waited in the car until after the "offence" happened, they were also only wearing all black with no high vis jackets on.

attributes.action: Create degrees and masters level apprenticeships for art and design disciplines.
attributes.background: Governments changes to creative education could contribute to the âcollapseâ of an industry worth billions to the UK economy. Apprenticeships in Higher Education should be available as these cover creative industry skills, requirements and occupational necessities. This increases many opportunities.
attributes.additional_details: Academic research by Birmingham City University looked at changes to design practice, policy and education over the last decade and demonstrated that the subject was being increasingly marginalised. The report, titled Beyond Discipline: Design Practice and Design Education in the 21st Century, which was published by the Universityâs Strategic Creativity Research Lab, found that design was being devalued by Government despite the industry accounting for 3.5 per cent of the countryâs GDP.

attributes.action: Stop smoking on bar verandahs/beer gardens/restaurant street tables
attributes.background: Why must i be confined to the indoors? Why must I have to miss out on enjoying warm days on verandahs/beer gardens because of someone elses anti social habits?
attributes.additional_details: The US and I believe some places in Scandinavia have already got this in place

attributes.action: Allow unrestricted work and residency visas for citizens of the commonwealth.
attributes.background: Commonwealth countries such as Canada, New Zealand and Australia have strong historical ties with our nation. Polls suggest all three countries are favourable to the idea, it would help alleviate concerns about mass immigration from countries with dissonant cultural values by offset.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/national/canadians-support-visa-free-travel-between-some-countries-poll/article29204662/?service=mobile

There are multiple sources that support this, I firmley believe it would ease the discord in our society, also it would provide fantastic opportunities for our citizens to learn about the world and enrich our society. I know it would need to be mutual between these nations but I believe we can start a dialogue, also drop NHS surcharge for those nationals.

attributes.action: UK public to be able to elect the Governor of the Bank of England.
attributes.background: The UK public elect its most influential people, Prime Minister, Chancellor, Home Secretary, Lord Mayor etc as a democracy. The UK public should also be able to elect the Governor of the Bank of England.
attributes.additional_details: The Governor of the Bank of England directly has control over the UK debt, availability of homes, interest rates. The governor also needs to have measurable objectives that his performance can be directly assessed.

attributes.action: Overseas military action to require super majority vote of two third of MPâs
attributes.background: The Petition's purpose is to ensure a higher percentage of the electorateâs views are taken account of when Parliament considers military action and that only Parliament can authorize the deployment of UK military forces as non-combative advisers in overseas conflicts to which the UK is not party.
attributes.additional_details:
A Parliamentary Motion for armed conflict is perhaps the most significant matter that our MPsâ are ever required to vote upon and as in the case of Iraq and subsequent conflicts their vote has had enormous repercussions for the United Kingdom, not only in terms of  those killed and wounded but in the aftermath, as now seen in Iraq, Afghanistan and Libya.

The present majority government received less than 37% of the vote from just 24% of the electorate at the 2015 General Election.

attributes.action: Regulate and reduce hospital car parking charges.
attributes.background: My son was admitted to Gloucester Royal and on every visit we had no choice but to use their car parks.  On one occasion we parked at 15.08 and left at 16.10 and were charged 2 hours and there was no allowance for any "time" to get your ticket and vacate the car park.

attributes.action: Make letter boxes for homeless people or people without an address.
attributes.background: In the UK we have a fantastic welfare system. Our country is one of the few countries in the world that provides help and benifits to those who are struggling to get by, but what about the people that have fallen off that ladder? Well to climb back up as you need an address to apply for benifits.
attributes.additional_details: That is where you come in by sighning the petition you will be helping homeless people regain there stability while they apply for benifits. Therefore helping change hundreds of thouasands of people regain a home and get off the streets for ever!

attributes.action: Mass build affordable homes to rent or buy. People can't afford to live!
attributes.background: House prices have increased to such a degree that even if you are approved for a mortgage, a moderate increase in interest rates will result in crippling poverty. For many a mortgage is impossible. Rent increases faster than wages. Isn't it time to address this problem?

attributes.action: Recognise Care Assistants as an actual career and better pay more than N.M.W.
attributes.background: Care Assistants should be recognised as an actual career path and should be paid better than the National Minimum Wage or 2016 renamed (National Living Wage) and be able to progress up the ladder with educational help available.
attributes.additional_details: People who go into the Vulnerable Adult Sector I.e. Care Assistants work 12 hour shifts sometimes do not even get time to have proper breaks because they are so busy get just the basic national minimum wage regardless of the new name and in some cases just don't even have the option to progress up the ladder this should be changed the minimum age should be changed to 21 to work as a Care Assistant and they should also feel valued Minimum Wage 12 Hour shifts does not make you feel valued.

attributes.action: Apply the triple lock to existing old age pensions up to the new annual rate.
attributes.background: The post April 6th 2016 pensions will be increased by 2.5% (min. per year) of the full amount starting with Â£155-65. Pensions being paid prior to April 6th 2016 will only be increased by 2.5% based on the basic of Â£119-30, not on any extras earned by older pensioners by SERPS, NI contributions etc.
attributes.additional_details: The idea of the petition is to make rises fairer for older pensioners after the start of the NEW FLAT RATE OLD AGE PENSION April 6th 2016. The way the government triple lock pension increases will be applied to pensioners entitled to draw old age pension prior to April 6th 2016 could cause them to lose out very considerably, relative to the new flat rate pensioners, in some economic circumstances. Example when the CONSUMER PRICE INDEX is static or falls as in the figure used in the 2016 rise.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to charge 3% tax on second homes   (retain for buy to let)
attributes.background: The Government introduced a 3% tax on purchases of second homes (over Â£40k) on 01/04/16. This was following a consultation on applying a 3% tax on buy to let properties. They did this to close a loop hole.  However, they haven't considered the consequences, or included it in any direct consultation.
attributes.additional_details:
This impacts you if you have your own home and purchase another property. This could be to help your parents, your children, your siblings, your friends. It has nothing to do with buy to let.

My sister looked after my parents as a single mum for 15 years, but they have both passed. She needs help to buy a home the Government can't provide. I will have to pay 3% tax on that home I can't afford.

Many more people will be impacted.  Please sign this petition.  It will impact you unfairly one day.

attributes.action: Legalise the sale,possession and consumption of hash heesh.
attributes.background: The consumption and classification of hash heesh seem to be less contentious than the questions over weed. Discuss any remaining obstructions to the legalisation of hash.

attributes.action: Restrict who can buy UK land and property to uk residents only
attributes.background: It is very concerning that persons who live in other countries and are not resident here are allowed to purchase housing stock, further pushing up prices for uk residents when there are limited resources.

attributes.action: Provide Prostheses rather than wigs for patients with total hair loss.
attributes.background: For seven years we have been asking our health provider to supply a human hair prosthesis that fits can be washed and styled.  Our GP and consultant are fully supportive but at the point of supply the bureaucrats say NO.
attributes.additional_details: Our dealings with the NHS medical professionals has been exemplary understanding  the emotional and mental strain caused by total hair loss particularly in a woman. However all requests for a proper prosthesis are denied for reasons that are unfathomable.  Example cost ( our proposal costs less ). Not NHS approved, (some trust supply). And of course the you need individual funding committee approval ( they always say NO that's their job, all requests made by doctors and consultants are ignored.

attributes.action: Ban all Pornographic material
attributes.background: Pornography is a fake stimulus which is crippling the expectations and behaviour of more people, the young especially. This industry exploits men and women, into a world where all dignity is degraded and even "shows off" illegal activity such as rape for others to enjoy. This encourages abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
Simply using safety filters is not enough. Many young children can easily by pass these filters, when Government and parents believe their children are safe.(http://www.expertreviews.co.uk/software/internet-security/1402585/how-your-kids-are-beating-your-parental-controls-and-is-there). 
One main argument for porn is that it helps couples. In more cases than not it DESTROYS relationships. (https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/tech-support/201407/what-porn-does-intimacy). So what is it for?

attributes.action: Use all car tax money's to repair roads and pot holes as suggested
attributes.background: I would love to drive on a smooth road with out hitting pot holes that no one seems to repair. We are forced to pay road tax and it seems the money we put in don't get used towards what it is mean for. I would also like to see cyclists pay road tax after all they use our roads
attributes.additional_details: The evidence is on every road in the UK. Holes in the roads are becoming  more and more frequent and this needs to be dealt with
